page.title: 08WRITTLE,PERSONAL MEMORIES
page.content: Mrs. Pamela Marden is 57 years old, and has lived in Writtle nearly all of her life except for five years.She was in a bomb scare in the middle of the war.The bomb was called a doodle bug. It landed in the school field.She lived first in Margretting Road,then in Towers Road and now finaly she lives in Daws Close.She told us that Longmeads used to be a private house.Writtle cricket team used to play cricket on The Green and if you hit it in the road it was a six.If it went into the pond a child would go and fetch it for half penny.Some people used to go to town by pony and trap, on a bike or by bus.In the days when she was young she had to amuse herself.She first got a television in the year 1952.It was a small black and white one.
